name: Arcanine
flavorText: This legendary Chinese Pokémon is considered magnificent. Many people are enchanted by its grand mane.

name: Azumarill
flavorText: When it plays in water, it rolls up its elongated ears to prevent their insides from getting wet.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Clefable
flavorText: With its acute hearing, it can pick up sounds from far away. It usually hides in quiet places.
Attack1Text: Return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

name: Gyarados
flavorText: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Hitmontop
flavorText: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Hitmontop by attacks is increased by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Jumpluff
flavorText: Once it catches the wind, it deftly controls its cotton-puff spores—it can even float around the world.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's).
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Jumpluff by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Ninetales
flavorText: Its nine beautiful tails are filled with a wondrous energy that could keep it alive for 1,000 years.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards. This power can't be used if Ninetales is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Noctowl
flavorText: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card. This power can't be used if Noctowl is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

name: Quagsire
flavorText: Due to its relaxed and carefree attitude, it often bumps its head on boulders and boat hulls as it swims.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Raichu
flavorText: If the electric pouches in its cheeks become fully charged, both ears will stand straight up.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy attached to Raichu.

name: Shuckle
flavorText: The berries it stores in its vase-like shell decompose and become a gooey liquid.
Ability1Text: As long as Shuckle is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Shuckle by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Slowking
flavorText: It has incredible intellect and intuition. Whatever the situation, it remains calm and collected.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 3 cards of that player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order. This power can't be used if Slowking is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Wobbuffet
flavorText: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to build up its counterstrike.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on Wobbuffet.

name: Ampharos
flavorText: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Ampharos does 20 damage to itself.

name: Ariados
flavorText: It spins string not only from its rear but also from its mouth. It's hard to tell which end is which.
Attack1Text: Remove from Ariados the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Butterfree
flavorText: Water-repellent powder on its wings enables it to collect honey, even in the heaviest of rains.
Attack1Text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

name: Cleffa
flavorText: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
Ability1Text: As long as Cleffa is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Cleffa by attacks.
Attack1Text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 6 cards. Cleffa is now Asleep.

name: Exeggutor
flavorText: If a head drops off, it emits a telepathic call in search of others to form an Exeggcute cluster.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to Exeggutor.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

name: Farfetch'd
flavorText: If it eats the plant stalk it carries as emergency rations, it runs off in search of a new stalk.
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.
Attack2Text: Switch Farfetch'd with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Feraligatr
flavorText: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Furret
flavorText: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pokémon to enter.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Granbull
flavorText: Because its fangs are too heavy, it always keeps its head tilted down. However, its bite is powerful.
Attack1Text: Granbull does 20 damage to itself. Switch Granbull with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Granbull.

name: Hypno
flavorText: Always holding a pendulum that it swings at a steady rhythm, it causes drowsiness in anyone nearby.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. This power can't be used if Hypno is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Lapras
flavorText: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their number has dwindled.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Ledian
flavorText: The spot patterns on its back grow larger or smaller depending on the number of stars in the night sky.
Attack1Text: Draw 3 cards.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Meganium
flavorText: Meganium's breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Remove 2 damage counters from Meganium.

name: Persian
flavorText: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, discard a card from your opponent's hand without looking.
Attack2Text: If Persian has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Pichu
flavorText: Despite its small size, it can zap even adult humans. However, if it does so, it also surprises itself.
Ability1Text: As long as Pichu is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Pichu by attacks.
Attack1Text: Each player may search his or her deck for as many Basic Pokémon as he or she likes, put them onto his or her Bench, and shuffle his or her deck afterward. (You put your Pokémon on the Bench first.) Pichu is now Asleep.

name: Sandslash
flavorText: If it digs at an incredible pace, it may snap off its spike and claws. They grow back in a day.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Smoochum
flavorText: Its lips are the most sensitive part of its body. It always uses its lips first to examine things.
Ability1Text: As long as Smoochum is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Smoochum by attacks.
Attack1Text: Move an Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon. Smoochum is now Asleep.

name: Sunflora
flavorText: It converts sunlight into energy. In the darkness after sunset, it closes its petals and becomes still.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Sunflora is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Typhlosion
flavorText: It has a secret, devastating move. It rubs its blazing fur together to cause huge explosions.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Typhlosion.

name: Tyrogue
flavorText: Even though it is small, it can't be ignored because it will slug any handy target without warning.
Ability1Text: As long as Tyrogue is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Tyrogue by attacks.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. Tyrogue is now Asleep.

name: Weezing
flavorText: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Weezing does 90 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness to this damage.

name: Bayleef
flavorText: A spicy aroma emanates from around its neck. The aroma acts as a stimulant to restore health.

name: Blissey
flavorText: Anyone who takes even one taste of Blissey's egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant to everyone.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Blissey.
Attack2Text: Blissey does 40 damage to itself.

name: Corsola
flavorText: It continuously sheds and grows. The tip of its head is prized as a treasure because of its beauty.
Attack1Text: Discard a Water Energy attached to Corsola and remove all damage counters from Corsola.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage.

name: Croconaw
flavorText: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Delibird
flavorText: It nests at the edge of sharp cliffs. It spends all day carrying food to its awaiting chicks.
Attack1Text: Draw a card for each Water Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Donphan
flavorText: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its tackle is strong enough to knock down a house.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage times the number of heads.

name: Dunsparce
flavorText: When spotted, this Pokémon escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Return Dunsparce and all cards attached to it to your hand.

name: Flaaffy
flavorText: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won't grow.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Heracross
flavorText: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies, then lifts and throws them.
Attack1Text: Draw a card for each of your Grass Pokémon in play.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

name: Igglybuff
flavorText: Its extremely flexible and elastic body makes it bounce continuously—anytime, anywhere.
Ability1Text: As long as Igglybuff is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Igglybuff by attacks.
Attack1Text: Igglybuff is now Asleep. During your opponent's next turn, the attack cost of each of the Defending Pokémon's attacks is Colorless more.

name: Mantine
flavorText: As it majestically swims, it doesn't care if Remoraid attach to it for scavenging its leftovers.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Water Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Mantine can't attack during your next turn.

name: Metapod
flavorText: It prepares for evolution by hardening its shell as much as possible to protect its soft body.
Ability1Text: Each of your Grass Pokémon has no Weakness.

name: Miltank
flavorText: If it is around babies, the milk it produces contains much more nutrition than usual.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Moomoo Milk card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Parasect
flavorText: The larger the mushroom on its back grows, the stronger the mushroom spores it scatters.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. Remove 4 damage counters from Parasect.

name: Quilava
flavorText: This Pokémon is fully covered by nonflammable fur. It can withstand any kind of fire attack.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy attached to Quilava.

name: Qwilfish
flavorText: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Skiploom
flavorText: The bloom on top of its head opens and closes as the temperature fluctuates up and down.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Slowbro
flavorText: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, it reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke.
Attack1Text: Both Slowbro and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to Slowbro.

name: Starmie
flavorText: The middle section of its body is called the core. It glows in a different color each time it is seen.
Attack1Text: Choose as many Water Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy you chose. Shuffle those cards back into your deck.

name: Unown
flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown from your hand onto your Bench, you may return all Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to your hand.

name: Unown
flavorText: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown from your hand onto your Bench, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

name: Wigglytuff
flavorText: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a Body Slam.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Wigglytuff by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Caterpie
flavorText: Its feet have suction cups designed to stick to any surface. It tenaciously climbs trees to forage.

name: Chansey
flavorText: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 3 damage counters from Chansey.

name: Chikorita
flavorText: Its pleasantly aromatic leaf has the ability to check the humidity and temperature.

name: Clefairy
flavorText: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Clefairy by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Cyndaquil
flavorText: It usually stays hunched over. If it is angry or surprised, it shoots flames out of its back.

name: Drowzee
flavorText: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children's are much tastier.
Attack1Text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Exeggcute
flavorText: Using telepathy only they can employ, they always form a cluster of six Exeggcute.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Girafarig
flavorText: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Growlithe
flavorText: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

name: Hoothoot
flavorText: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Hoppip
flavorText: To keep from being blown away by the wind, they gather in clusters. But they do enjoy gentle breezes.
Attack1Text: You may switch Hoppip with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Jigglypuff
flavorText: Looking into its cute, round eyes causes it to sing a relaxing melody, inducing its enemies to sleep.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Jynx
flavorText: It rocks its body rhythmically. It appears to alter the rhythm depending on how it is feeling.
Attack1Text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Koffing
flavorText: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Ledyba
flavorText: When the weather turns cold, lots of Ledyba gather from everywhere to cluster and keep each other warm.
Attack2Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Magikarp
flavorText: For no reason, it jumps and splashes about, making it easy for predators like Pidgeotto to catch it mid-jump.

name: Mareep
flavorText: If static electricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a number of Lightning Energy cards up to the number of Mareep in play (both yours and your opponent's) and attach them to Mareep. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Marill
flavorText: The end of its tail serves as a buoy that keeps it from drowning, even in a vicious current.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Meowth
flavorText: It loves anything that shines. It especially adores coins that it picks up and secretly hoards.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Paras
flavorText: As its body grows large, large mushrooms named tochukaso start sprouting out of its back.
Attack2Text: Paras does 10 damage to itself.

name: Phanpy
flavorText: It swings its long snout around playfully, but because it is so strong, that can be dangerous.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Phanpy.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Sandshrew
flavorText: Disliking water, it lives in deep burrows in arid areas. It can roll itself instantly into a ball.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Sandshrew by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

name: Sentret
flavorText: A very cautious Pokémon, it raises itself up using its tail to get a better view of its surroundings.
Attack1Text: Look at your opponent's hand.

name: Slowpoke
flavorText: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Snubbull
flavorText: It has an active, playful nature. Many women like to frolic with it because of its affectionate ways.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

name: Spinarak
flavorText: It lies still in the same pose for days in its web, waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Staryu
flavorText: At night, the center of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.

name: Sunkern
flavorText: It may plummet from the sky. If attacked by a Spearow, it will violently shake its leaves.
Attack1Text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Totodile
flavorText: Its powerful, well-developed jaws are capable of crushing anything. Even its trainer must be careful.

name: Vulpix
flavorText: If it is attacked by an enemy that is stronger than itself, it feigns injury to fool the enemy and escapes.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Vulpix.

name: Wooper
flavorText: When it walks around on the ground, it coats its body with a slimy, poisonous film.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Ampharos
Ability1Text: Whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from his or her hand to 1 of his or her Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage. If tails, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Blissey
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you play Blissey from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may remove all damage counters from all of your Pokémon. If you do, discard all Energy attached to those Pokémon that had any damage counters on them.

name: Donphan
Ability1Text: Any damage done to Donphan by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Feraligatr
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Water Pokémon. This power can't be used if Feraligatr is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Meganium
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Grass Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Meganium is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Typhlosion
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Typhlosion is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy card attached to Typhlosion and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Ho-Oh LEGEND
flavorText: Legends claim this Pokémon flies the world's skies continuously on its magnificent, seven-colored wings.
Ability1Text: All Energy attached to Ho-Oh LEGEND are Fire Energy instead of their usual type.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy attached to Ho-Oh LEGEND.

name: Ho-Oh LEGEND
flavorText: Legends claim this Pokémon flies the world's skies continuously on its magnificent, seven-colored wings.
Ability1Text: All Energy attached to Ho-Oh LEGEND are Fire Energy instead of their usual type.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy attached to Ho-Oh LEGEND.

name: Lugia LEGEND
flavorText: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Lugia LEGEND into play, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck and attach all Energy cards you find there to Lugia LEGEND. Discard the other cards.
Attack1Text: Discard a Fire Energy, Water Energy, and Lightning Energy attached to Lugia LEGEND.

name: Lugia LEGEND
flavorText: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Lugia LEGEND into play, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck and attach all Energy cards you find there to Lugia LEGEND. Discard the other cards.
Attack1Text: Discard a Fire Energy, Water Energy, and Lightning Energy attached to Lugia LEGEND.

name: Gyarados
flavorText: They say that during past strife, Gyarados would appear and leave blazing ruins in its wake.
Attack1Text: If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, Gyarados does 20 damage to itself.
